title.native: 異世界魔王と召喚少女の奴隷魔術
title.romaji: Isekai Maou to Shoukan Shoujo no Dorei Majutsu
title.english: How NOT to Summon a Demon Lord

description:
In the MMORPG Cross Reverie, Takuma Sakamoto is so powerful that he is lauded as the “Demon Lord” by other players. One day, he is summoned to another world – but with the same appearance he had in the game! There, he meets two girls who both proclaim themselves to be his Summoner. They had performed an Enslavement Ritual to turn him into their Summon... but that's when Takuma's passive ability <> activated! Instead, it was the girls who had become enslaved! Though Takuma may have been the strongest Sorcerer there was, he had no idea how to talk with other people. That's when he makes his choice: to act based on his persona from the game!

“Amazing? But of course... I am Diablo, the being known and feared as the Demon Lord!”

So begins a tale of adventure with an earth-shakingly powerful Demon Lord (or at least someone who acts like one) taking on another world!

(Source: J-Novel Club)
synonyms: The King of Darkness Another World Story
异世界魔王与召唤少女的奴隶魔术
จอมมารต่างโลกกับ บริวารสาวนักอัญเชิญ

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yumi_hara.0121/)

**Birthplace:** Osaka Prefecture, Japan

She was discovered in 81 Produce's 3rd Seiyuu Audition in August, 2009, becoming one of the seven finalists amongst 1,109 who took initially part and won the excellence prize in the end. She made her debut in a minor role for the anime [Sasameki Koto](https://anilist.co/anime/6203).

(Source: AniDB)

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.

[Website](https://yu-serizawa.com/) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=229) | [Profile (i☆Ris)](https://iris.dive2ent.com/profile/member.php?id=1000226) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/@iRis_s_yu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/seriko_is_no.1/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu_Serizawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芹澤優)

Yuu Serizawa is a voice actress and member of the anisong and idol unit [i☆Ris](https://anilist.co/staff/131442), signed to DIVE II Entertainment, a sub-label of Avex Entertainment. She is associated with the color blue in the unit.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Nina - Memento Mori (VG)
• Bay - NIKKE: Goddess of Victory (VG)
• Nicole - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
• Gentildonna - Uma Musume: Pretty Derby (VG)
• Asakura Karen - Heaven Burns Red (VG)
